cards.question: Who founded the Mughal Empire in India?
cards.answer: Bābur founded the Mughal Empire in 1526 after defeating Ibrahim Lodi in the First Battle of Panipat.

cards.question: Name the longest-reigning Mughal emperor and highlight one of his accomplishments.
cards.answer: Akbar the Great (reigned 1556–1605) was the longest-reigning Mughal emperor. He established a centralized administrative system and promoted religious tolerance through his policy of Sulh-i-Kul.
